job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros:
Competitive salary, sufficient paid time off, good health benefit.
Room for growth. 
Many locations.
Depending on work location, co-workers get along and are supportive of one another.  
Company  has good potentials but management is delusional.  .
cons: High and fluctuating caseload, too many and too frequent  changes, case management responsibilities and very unstructured processes not suitable for such high caseloads 120+ .  Company is big on policies and protocols that only look good paper but impossible to apply to the real day to day workflow. No support for ancillary work. The clerical duties interfere with nurses ability to provide effective case management to their members. Supervisors micromanage but are incompetent and have no management skills. Changes are so frequent that neither management nor the educators in the staff development have  the answers. Inadequate training. Incompetent educators.Employees input not valued. The top management is totally disconnected from the staff. High standards are set but can't be lived up to due to excessively high case load, no support staff and poor leadership. I have met some great nurses who end up leaving due to poor work condition and support.

pros: The benefits for a clerical staff are pretty impressive as entry level. The growth is not impossible should you perform exceptionally well. Unionized position and pretty standard increases, employer contribution to retirement plan and they do offer a amazing medical coverage options, mines for example i paid no premiums into! Please note this company has changed their name to "lighthouse guild international"
cons: union is not as strong as it boasts, other departments are favored as well as other titles are more favored, its the prime example of he ones who have been there for years do minimal work and other pick up the slack, have i mentioned the chronic "favorite worker" a lot of people get away with things for the seniority and the kissing up to management. restructuring to pilot programs saw the best opportunity to kindly dump employees and not offer a comprehensive severance package. alot of newer positions open up on a "need to know basis".

review_title: A Morgue is a Happier Place than Lighthouse Guild
pros: Pay and benefits and some colleagues
cons: The CEO and upper management

pros: Thankful to be employed through COVID, but this place is literally the most unorganized circus I've ever seen. I guess I turned this pro into a con.
cons:
Not sure where to start. For a blindness agency, they do little for the community. It's the employees, that do all the work and carry the agency on their backs. We do all the work, we get no perks, no appreciation, and tons of pushback.

We recently got a new CEO. Hoping he is better than the narcissist we had. Our former CEO knew and cared nothing about the community we worked for. He was too busy giving himself a 700k raise and closing programs. Not to mention the mass layoff period we had at the end of 2019.

job_title: Vision Rehabilitation Specialist in Niagara Falls, NY
pros: I love serving others. There is an trust among workers that allows us to serve the needs of a diverse set of individuals and bring value to all involved. Lighthouse Guild has set a high standard of performance and provides resources to reach a common goal.
cons: There has been a change within our program that has hindered my growth. Managed Care is now deciding who can attend our program. Those who need my service as a Vision Rehabilitation Specialist has shrunk.

job_title: Nurse Case Manager in Long Is City, NY
pros: Has union UFT.  PTO very good with vacation,sick and  floating holidays.Salary decent. You will pay for time off however as you  will be covering other  nurses' caseloads of 100 + at least  1-2 x per week.
cons: Bad working conditions with nurse case managers  being given more and more clerical work so clerical staff can answer the phones instead. Management treats NCMs with little respect even though they are nurses themselves.Frequent turnover of nursing staff. Low morale. Work here at your own risk!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: For the most part, people are knowledgeable, professional and do good work for the population they serve
cons: Some management is not flexible to their employees needs, work life balance. What is ok for some managers and employees is not ok for otgers. Need to be more fair

job_title: Case Manager in New York, NY
pros: Coworkers were great. Good benefits.
cons: Micromanaging, doesn't trust experienced employees. Not much room for growth.

review_title: Great mission but support from executive office and service staff is minimal if not confusing.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Contributing to a very good cause and many people there are excellent to work with.  Listing this company on your resume may still look very good. Good for an internship.
cons: No room for growth and many do not seem to stay there long.  Peculiar operation policies challenge and limit productivity.  Typical non-profit base pay.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Lighthouse International helps those who are blind and visually impaired. From caring and expert eye care to their other services such as their music school, they provide excellent services. They have a volunteer appreciation event every year. It is a big event and it is very enjoyable.
cons: I enjoy my volunteer work at Lighthouse International. I have no downsides to report.

job_title: Social Worker in New York, NY
pros: The department is well run and middle management is supportive.
cons: Very limited support staff and clinicians do a great deal of administrative work.  High caseloads with stress on numbers.  Documentation requirements have been streamlined but are still extensive.

pros: The organization supports a wonderful cause and each day can fulfilling as you interact with clients who are young and old.
cons: The senior management offers very little informative communication and is typically insulated from staffers daily routine. Any typical day can have a demanding routine.

pros: Work hours and the benefits.
cons: You never knew what underhanded sneaky plans they had going on. Did not care about the clients or students that were disabled just the numbers$$

pros: Wonderful working environment with great team support. Direct supervisors care a great deal about the children and overall happiness of the staff.The children and the families are wonderful.
cons: Mixed messages from the HR department. HR places the corporation above the needs of the children.

job_title: Intake Nurse Manager in New York, NY

cons: Lack of support by supervisors , alot of overtime without compensation, inconsistent management , no support, no longer feels patient centered

pros: The elevator works sometimes. Free hot water until 10:00 am. No more things to say just need twenty words. Thank you.
cons: Upward mobility lacking. Benefits non existent. Cafeteria ridiculously over priced. Management refuses to pay people what they're worth. Thank you very much.

Union that is there but not there for you.

review_title: Great kids, not so great adults
